item.title: For its first anniversary, Monster Hunter Wilds gets a collab with its kid friendly cousin, and the promise of some DLC
item.content:encoded:
Amongst other bits and pieces

Monster Hunter Wilds is fast approaching its first anniversary, meaning if it were a real human baby it would be legally unable to do anything really because have you met a one year old? Still, ahead of that anniversary, Capcom has outlined the game's next big update which, shock horror, includes a new monster to hunt, a new weapon to hunt with, a collab with basically itself, and more coming on February 18th. Oh, and there's DLC coming! But once again, the horror, the shock.

First, that new monster; this one is the 10 star Arch-tempered Arkveld which is joining as part of a permanent event quest. He's a big, dark, lightningy looking guy, not much to say about him. That new weapon is a doozy, at least stylistically, as it's basically what if Cloud's Buster Sword was a broken mirror. Looking mighty fine honestly, and comes as part of a weapon design contest, made by one Nolan Lu. Nice work Nolan!

The aforementioned collab is specifically with Monster Hunter Stories 3: Twisted Reflection (you see, itself!), which features a new side mission you can only get if you have a hunter rank of nine or higher. It's permanent though, so don't worry about missing out on it. The mission itself sees you teaming up with Rudy, a more cel shaded Palico from Stories 3, who needs you to find some monster eggs he dropped. Deliver enough eggs, and you can get rewards like a Rudy costume for your Palico, and a few different pendants too.

From the release of this update on February 18th through to March 18th, there'll be an anniversary event where you can "collect a special anniversary login bonus, and join in the seasonal festivitiesâ€”a weekly rotation of each previous Festival of Accord!"

In terms of the DLC, details are slim pickings, but it will apparently be a "large-scale expansion," with plans to share more details about it in the summer according to this Steam blog post. It's something I guess! Look forward to it at your own risk.
